publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2440 Stewart Stevenson: Microcredit—That the Parliament applauds the growth in the microcredit movement which was started in 1976 when Professor Muhammad Yunus lent 26 dollars to a group of 42 Bangladeshi workers to finance a day’s work; notes that defaults are infrequent; supports the movement as a key way of empowering the excluded around the world, especially women, and calls on world leaders to include discussions at the forthcoming G8 summit in Scotland on how they may help the movement and directly assist individuals to participate in and contribute to the growth of their local economy.
S2M-2440 Microcredit (lodged on 17 February 2005) Michael Matheson*
